description: Examples of nested conditional logic (if within if)

input.natural_language: Check if person can drive (age >= 18 AND has license)

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:if condition="{age} >= 18">
  <q:if condition="{hasLicense} == true">
    You can drive!
  <q:else/>
    Please get a license first.
  </q:if>
<q:else/>
  You're too young to drive.
</q:if>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Checks both age and license status with nested conditions

input.natural_language: Check admin role, then specific permissions

expected_output.quantum_code: View Only
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Shows different UI based on role and permissions

input.natural_language: Check country, then state, then city for shipping

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:if condition="{country} == 'USA'">
  <q:if condition="{state} == 'CA'">
    <q:if condition="{city} == 'San Francisco'">
      Free shipping!
    <q:else/>
      Standard CA shipping
    </q:if>
  <q:else/>
    Standard USA shipping
  </q:if>
<q:else/>
  International shipping
</q:if>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Three levels of geographic checks for shipping rules

input.natural_language: Check if user is premium, then check order amount for discount

expected_output.quantum_code:
<q:if condition="{isPremium} == true">
  Premium member:
  <q:if condition="{orderAmount} >= 100">
    20% discount applied
  <q:elseif condition="{orderAmount} >= 50"/>
    10% discount applied
  <q:else/>
    5% discount applied
  </q:if>
<q:else/>
  Regular pricing
</q:if>
expected_output.runtime_behavior: Tiered discounts for premium members based on order amount
